result.execSummary:
The defendant Sharon D Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Credit for eight days in the event sentence is imposed at a later date.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory costs, fees and DNA surcharges.  To be paid during term of probation or civil judgment.  Bail to apply.
No contact with the victim security guard.

timeConds.notes: STAYED to be used at the discretion of the agent.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sharon D Thomas in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

 Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statment by Mario H. 

Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for 8 days time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for ONE YEAR with the following conditions:
*attend anger managment class
*no contact with the victim(security guard)
*25 days condition time stayed and to be used at the discretion of the agent. 
*pay all mandatory costs, fees and dna surcharges during term of probation or civil judgment, apply the bail on deposit.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Sharon D Thomas in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sharon D Thomas in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 10-29-2015 at 08:30 am.

  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-18-2015 at 08:30 am.

  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-11-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sharon D Thomas in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered stayed warrant cancelled and bail reinstated.   Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 47. lr  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 07-31-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Discussion of defendant's non-appearance placed on the record. Court STAYED a bench warrant. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Calendar call scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Terry F.    AND/OR  their place of residence    AND/OR   their place of employment

Defendant Sharon D Thomas in court.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-096

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Branch 47 for a Pretrial Conference.
